cs.tcd.ie

Class Server

  • java.lang.Object
    • cs.tcd.ie.Node
      • cs.tcd.ie.Server

  • public class Server
extends Node
    Server class an instance receivers packets, sends ACK packets and keeps track of clients and sequence numbers; will send ACK or NAK to client depending on received packet

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods

      Returns the expected sequence number of the server as Int.

      Sets the expected sequence of the server to 0.

      Sets the sequence of the packet to nxtSeqNr.

      Initializes the server to wait for packets.
      void timeout()
      timeout method is called by the node abstract class when a timeout exception occurs will alert the user how long it's been waiting for a packet

      Updates the expected sequence of the server.

    • Method Detail

      • onReceipt

        public void onReceipt(java.net.DatagramPacket packet)
        Assume that incoming packets contain a sensorInfo. will check a hashmap for packets for an ID and match the sequence number from the packet with the last sequence number it got from a packet with the same ID. Caches ID's from new clients in a hashmap to track different sequence numbers
        Specified by:
        onReceipt in class Node
        Parameters:
        packet - packet being analyised

      • getNxtSeqNr

        public int getNxtSeqNr()
        Returns the expected sequence number of the server as Int.
        Returns:
        Returns the nxtSeqNr of the server as Int.

      • resetNxtSeqNr

        public void resetNxtSeqNr()
        Sets the expected sequence of the server to 0.

      • updateNxtSeqNr

        public void updateNxtSeqNr()
        Updates the expected sequence of the server. Increments it by one.

      • setNxtSeqNr

        public void setNxtSeqNr(int nxtSeqNr)
        Sets the sequence of the packet to nxtSeqNr.
        Parameters:
        nxtSeqNr - nxtSeqNr to put into the packet

      • start

        public void start()
           throws java.lang.Exception
        Initializes the server to wait for packets.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • main

        public static void main()
        Main method Starts the server

      • timeout

        public void timeout()
        timeout method is called by the node abstract class when a timeout exception occurs will alert the user how long it's been waiting for a packet
